page.title: 03FEATURES: BROWNHILLS AREA.
page.content: An urban and industrial landscape is found in the Brownhills/Walsall Wood area. High-rise blocks of flats, large housing estates, the Maybrook Industrial Estate, the Wyrley and Essington Canal and Brownhills Shopping Centre are features of note. Some of the land eg. near Clayhanger, has suffered from subsidence due to earlier coalmining but infilling and reclamation has partly remedied this problem. The eastern area consists mainly of a rural landscape but the village of Stonnall provides some interesting historical buildings eg. St Peter's Church, the Manor House, Fighting Cocks Farm and Barn, the old Vicarage, Worsley House, Lynn Hall, the Old School House. The Iron Age hill fort known as Castle Fort is situated on the ridge overlooking Stonnall.
